## Discussion

Window levels provide a relative grouping of windows along the z-axis. All windows assigned to the same window level appear in front of (or behind) all windows assigned to a different window level. The ordering of windows within a given window level is not guaranteed.

# windowLevel

**Instance Property**

The position of the window in the z-axis.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var windowLevel: UIWindow.Level { get set }
```

## Discussion

Window levels provide a relative grouping of windows along the z-axis. All windows assigned to the same window level appear in front of (or behind) all windows assigned to a different window level. The ordering of windows within a given window level is not guaranteed.

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindow/Level/normal]. For a list of other possible window levels, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindow/Level].

## Configuring the window

- **rootViewController**: The root view controller for the window.
- **UIWindow.Level**: The positioning of windows relative to each other.
- **canResizeToFitContent**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window’s constraint-based content determines its size.
- **screen**: The screen to display the window on.
